name: Trigger Finger (Stenosing Tenosynovitis)
chief_complaint: My finger gets stuck when I try to straighten it, and it hurts when I move it.
symptoms: Finger catching or locking when bent
Pain at the base of the affected finger
Tenderness or a nodule in the palm
physical_findings: Palpable nodule at the A1 pulley
Snapping or popping sensation with finger movement
prognosis: Excellent with treatment; most patients recover full function
description: Trigger finger is a condition where one of the fingers gets stuck in a bent position and then straightens with a snap. It occurs due to inflammation of the tendon sheath, causing the tendon to catch or lock as it moves.
